Update readme to reflect the new distributed lzo indexer.

Borrowing from Todd Lipcon's great work, added a distributed lzo indexer.  It indexes lzo files in a map reduce job, one mapper per file, using custom input and output formats.  Moving the indexing computation away from a local process is a big step forward. Thanks Todd.
Fix a typo, and add an updated jar -- it was compiling against a pre-release 0.20 jar.
Refactor calling of git into a script so we can override with an env var
Expose the tmp filename the index writes to so that it can be cleaned up upon failure, and use the proper Path api for appending to filenames.
Add a couple simple functions to the LzoIndex to allow introspecting its block positions.
Make LzoIndex.createIndex properly cleanup after itself on failure, and fix some formatting in the javadoc.
Add idea projects to .gitignore, add build properties to jar, and log build's git revision once upon static load.
Update readme to reflect more of the bugs that have been fixed.
Don't leave behind old attempts at index files when exceptions are thrown during LzoIndex.createIndex, e.g. when the lzo file is corrupt.
Don't leave behind old attempts at index files when exceptions are thrown during LzoIndex.createIndex, e.g. when the lzo file is corrupt.
Change name to hadoop-lzo, use it for maven name
Remove reference to src/contrib so ant package works
Handle corruption better by catching exceptions hierarchically.
Catch an EOF exception that wasn't being caught before (happened when file writers were killed unexpectedly).
Allow the LzopInputStream to gracefully handle a file that does not finish with four trailing zeroes, as can happen when a writer gets killed.
Upgrade the version just a bit to reflect the bug fix.

LZOP mandates that blocks which compress to a larger size than their uncompressed size should be stored uncompressed with a slightly modified header.  hadoop-gpl-compression does not honor this in reading or writing, which left it unable to read files with such blocks.  I fixed this issue a few commits I go; this should be the corresponding fix to be able to properly write such blocks.  Added a test for the LzopOutputStream too.  The smallest test file led to this condition, so 1/3 tests initially failed, and now all pass.
Hammerbacher inadvertantly reminded me that there were no GPL headers on the top of the new files.  Add them for consistency with the rest.
Add information on usage to the README

The main changes. Many are (unfortunately) whitespace caused by Eclipse's code formatter.  Diff with no whitespace to remove that part.  Much of the rest is a reorganization of the files because I kept getting tired of looking through long files for nested inner classes.  I broke things out into their own classes and files.  I also added a com.hadoop.mapred.DeprecatedLzoTextInputFormat to go along with the com.hadoop.mapreduce.LzoTextInputFormat -- applications like streaming still need a class derived from org.apache.hadoop.mapred.InputFormat, so this is one way to make streaming work until it's fixed.  In the process of doing that, I ran into some code that was (a) repeated and (b) looked like it should be part of the LzoIndex class anyway, like createIndex and readIndex.  I added that and another couple simple functions to the LzoIndex class.
Add in my patch to issue 17.
First, commit up to r41 of the mainline code.google.com/hadoop-gpl-compression.
